The NIA has seized another vehicle, examined 73 witnesses, and continues probing the wider conspiracy.

The BJP dismissed the allegations, urging the BJD to accept the voters' decision.

title: Immigrant crackdown: UK govt set to overhaul asylum system – what’s changing

A tale of three yatras: Why Rahul, Tejashwi and PK failed - and BJP didn't

The BJP-led NDA won more than 202 of 243 seats, leaving the INDIA bloc weakened. Rahul’s “vote chori” message failed to resonate, Tejashwi’s tour did not expand his support, and Kishor’s long padyatra ended without a single victory, showing that spectacle cannot replace organisation in Bihar’s caste-driven politics.

This arrest is a major breakthrough in uncovering the larger conspiracy.

Stephen Curry's recent 49-point performance highlights Golden State's strong form.

description: CPI(ML)L general secretary Dipankar Bhattacharya described the Bihar election results as "abnormal," attributing them to three "experiments." description: Bihar's 2025 election saw the RJD secure the highest vote share but a drastically low seat tally, while the NDA achieved a landslide victory. The RJD's votes were spread thinly, resulting in many second-place finishes, a consequence of India's 'First Past the Post' system. The NDA's strategic alliances and efficient vote conversion led to their dominant win.

description: New research suggests vitamin D supplementation may modestly reduce the risk of major cardiovascular issues, including heart attacks, particularly in older adults. While not a dramatic effect, it adds to evidence of vitamin D's broader health benefits beyond bone and immunity. This could offer an additional layer of support for long-term heart health, especially for those already managing cardiac risks.

title: 'You deserve to lose': Ex-ENG captain's attack on Eden Gardens pitch; hails WTC champs
description: Michael Vaughan slammed the Eden Gardens pitch after India's Test defeat to South Africa, calling it 'awful'.  However, Gautam Gambhir defended the conditions, stating they were precisely what the team desired.  Despite the controversy, South Africa secured a victory within three days, highlighting the challenging nature of the surface for both sides.

title: Malayalam’s greatest actor served in Army and police before cinema; redefined screen acting; kept working despite coughing up blood on set due to leukaemia
IND vs SA: No demons? Eden surface draws fire after India’s shock defeat
description: India head coach Gautam Gambhir insisted there were “no demons” in the Eden Gardens pitch despite a two-and-a-half-day Test marked by variable bounce and sharp turn. Former greats Dale Steyn, Anil Kumble and Cheteshwar Pujara disagreed, calling the surface unfair and luck-driven. With India’s batting faltering and WTC points lost, the bigger question lingers: do pitches like these serve Test cricket at all?

‘Insensitive ask’: Employee told to stay ‘available’ after grandfather’s death; netizens react
description: A viral Reddit post highlighted Indian workplaces' lack of empathy, where a grieving employee was asked to attend a meeting after his grandfather's death. This incident resonated deeply, exposing a culture where personal hardship is often disregarded for work demands. The story underscores the urgent need for better boundaries and human-centric policies.

'Bihar approves gobhi farming': Assam minister's post ignites fury; Shashi Tharoor reacts
description: Assam Minister Ashok Singhal's X post referencing "gobhi farming" after Bihar election results has ignited controversy. Critics believe it alludes to the 1989 Bhagalpur riots' "cauliflower burial case," where victims' bodies were allegedly concealed under cauliflower fields. Social media users condemned the perceived insensitivity, prompting a response from Shashi Tharoor who denounced such massacres.

BMC plans 4.24-km flyover linking Kurla and Ghatkopar along LBS Marg to ease congestion in Mumbai’s eastern suburbs
'Facilities have been attacked': Iran reacts to Nuclear enrichment reports
description: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi denied reports of undeclared uranium enrichment, stating that all facilities are monitored by the IAEA. He attributed the current lack of enrichment to recent attacks on its facilities, while asserting Iran's undeniable right to peaceful nuclear technology.

title: Old bikes with poor mileage a major source of pollution: DTU study

Maharashtra Local Body Election 2025: Polling date, major parties, result day – All you need to know
DMs and drones: Amritsar police busts Pakistan-linked arms & drugs network; five arrested
description: Amritsar police have dismantled a Pakistan-linked arms and drug network, arresting five individuals and seizing six pistols and over a kilogram of heroin. Investigations revealed the accused coordinated with handlers in Pakistan via social media and drones for smuggling operations into Punjab.  FIRs have been registered, and efforts continue to root out the entire syndicate.

title: After controversial 'bauna' remarks, Bumrah, Bavuma locked in chat; fans go berserk
description: Jasprit Bumrah and Temba Bavuma shared a composed conversation after India's 30-run defeat to South Africa, putting aside a Day 1 controversy. South Africa secured a historic Test win in India, defending 124 runs on a challenging Eden Gardens pitch. The post-match exchange signaled that there were no hard feelings between the two.

IND vs SA: Anil Kumble ‘confused’ by Gautam Gambhir’s comments that Eden Gardens pitch was exactly what India wanted
‘What will happen to us now?’ ask untainted candidates who could not make it to WBSSC interview list
'Rs 14K cr from World Bank funds used in Bihar polls': Jan Suraaj's big charge; Chirag hits back
description: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party alleged the Bihar government diverted World Bank funds for cash transfers to women voters before elections. Spokesperson Pavan Verma claimed Rs 14,000 crore was used, tilting the electoral field. Union Minister Chirag Paswan dismissed these claims as baseless.

description: Team India faced a disappointing 30-run loss to South Africa in Kolkata. Head coach Gautam Gambhir highlighted the young batting lineup's struggle with pressure during tough Test cricket sessions. The team must now focus on improving their temperament and building resilience ahead of the 2nd Test in Guwahati set to commence on Saturday.

Morning poop vs evening poop: What the timing reveals about metabolism
description: Your daily poop timing offers vital clues about your gut and metabolism.  Morning bowel movements indicate a healthy internal clock.  Evening or random timings may signal stress or disrupted eating patterns.  Paying attention to these signals can reveal important insights into your overall metabolic well-being.  Fiber, hydration, and a healthy gut microbiome also play key roles.

title: India fall apart without Gill; Harmer inspires South Africa’s 30-run win
description: South Africa secured a thrilling 30-run victory over India in the first Test, with Simon Harmer's eight wickets proving decisive. India, chasing 124, faltered to 93, hampered by the absence of captain Shubman Gill due to injury. Keshav Maharaj and Aiden Markram also played key roles in the win, giving the Proteas a 1-0 series lead.

Ignoring own orders, Supreme Court has kept case in limbo since 2018
description: The Supreme Court is set to hear a plea to lift a seven-year-old stay on a CBI probe into tiger poaching in Corbett Tiger Reserve. The probe had suggested forest officials' connivance with poachers. The CBI itself has sought vacation of the stay, citing preliminary findings of irregularities and cover-ups. An environmentalist argues the prolonged stay hinders dismantling poaching networks.

title: India vs South Africa highlights, 1st Test Day 3 Updates: SA beat IND by 30 runs in Kolkata
Shaken and stirred: Can bygones be bygones?
Why your blood sugar is high in the morning: major risk factors, and how to manage it
description: High fasting blood sugar in the morning can be due to the dawn phenomenon, a natural hormone surge, or the less common Somogyi effect, a rebound from low overnight glucose. Experts like Dr. Joseph Tejero emphasize that stress, poor sleep, late meals, and medication timing also contribute, requiring a holistic management approach.

title: Toronto in talks to land Cubs’ $460 million standout as blockbuster trade looms
description: The Toronto Blue Jays are reportedly frontrunners to acquire elite two-way outfielder Kyle Tucker from the Houston Astros. This blockbuster move could significantly boost Toronto's championship aspirations by adding a consistent, game-changing bat to their lineup. The trade would address Houston's payroll constraints while providing them with valuable young talent for the future.

title: Kayla Nicole accused of using AI for apology as fans analyse her statement
description: Kayla Nicole faces renewed online backlash over decade-old offensive tweets. Her subsequent apology has ignited a debate, with accusations of using AI to craft her statement. Critics question the sincerity of her remorse, while others argue the focus should be on her growth and acknowledging past harm, not AI detection.

title: ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ sparks theories: Taylor Swift revisits her Joe Alwyn breakup
description: Taylor Swift's new song, 'The Fate of Ophelia,' is fueling fan theories linking it to her breakup with Joe Alwyn.  Swifties interpret lyrics about rescue and rebirth as a nod to her current relationship, contrasting it with her past. The track is seen as Swift reclaiming her narrative, transforming heartbreak into art.

title: Bihar-UP relationship like Ram-Sita, ‘unbreakable and strong’, says UP CM Yogi
description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath likened the bond between Uttar Pradesh and Bihar to that of Lord Ram and Sita, celebrating the NDA's landslide victory in Bihar. He inaugurated and laid foundations for 432 projects worth Rs 548 crore in Sonbhadra, emphasizing development and good governance for tribal communities.

title: Who is Patrick Beverley’s sister? Key facts after his felony arrest
description: Former NBA player Patrick Beverley faces a felony assault charge in Texas after an incident involving his younger sister, Mya. Beverley was reportedly concerned upon finding Mya with an 18-year-old man late at night. His attorney stated Beverley has no prior record and expressed doubt about the incident's description, anticipating a court resolution.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly rethinks wedding to Travis Kelce for a grander celebration
description: Pop superstar Taylor Swift is reportedly planning a grand wedding for Travis Kelce.  The celebration is expected to be a major cultural event, reflecting her global status.  Sources suggest a guest list of over 300, with performances from friends.  The wedding is rumored for early to mid-2026, marking a significant new chapter.

title: Chat on WhatsApp instantly: Steps to text unsaved numbers; no new contact required
description: WhatsApp now allows users to message without saving numbers. This feature, 'Click to Chat,' lets you initiate conversations via a special link. You can even pre-fill messages. Businesses can use the official 'Chat on WhatsApp' button on their sites for easy customer contact, streamlining communication and decluttering your phone.

title: Mark Zuckerberg's charity insight: Researchers demanding GPUs; reject space and staff
description: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan's philanthropic organisation, CZI, is now prioritising computing power, specifically GPUs, over physical expansion for its science and AI mission.  Researchers at Biohub are demanding more GPUs, which Chan describes as 'new lab space' that is more expensive than traditional facilities. This strategic shift aims to accelerate breakthroughs in AI-powered biology.
